subject: Vulnerability with the JetMenu plugin
preview: Hey @manuel , just passing this your way. No rush, but if no vulnerabilities are found, feel free to just leave a quick note and close the ticket afterwards. Thanks!

action.text: Manuel Lito Manceli marked as Closed

full_threads.body: Hey @manuel , just passing this your way. No rush, but if no vulnerabilities are found, feel free to just leave a quick note and close the ticket afterwards. Thanks!

action.text: Workflow **Vulnerability assigned to Manuel** was triggered

full_threads.body:
Hello Andy, We are writing to you today to notify you about a security
vulnerability
<https://u9019290.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.6QPP-2FqJt5LKc0sK5s9FWukL6eYjGRlUZGKIx7PMBk86sfEh2sNs6rQ7gEjrd4hewBmFZTJE1ZwLz0neCD3WJ5mwub8Cq3QkNcmQC7MsnpN8-3D_x0M_QhWGwQhi9gh0EXq7EEln2gTtEY8uizMkeyIYnCUJGKBxDCOY-2FXiHEygCmLGWHMZTmnup5gN7nCSxUkjAWg2-2BuAewsSpDa4ufBTFQs6W72lHFEMXtuueMADk4cDMFEOsVj88weLNCGcp6jSXo5GsulJu6c4Q79gSfUfrIvDtkj8h9I-2FhqALfDgWblNBCz8sQ00sBwezAkzOvvkaZV6O6RYEeXA-2FYYWSQ301F0JLa9FklUuwaG1ze-2FaCq7WR3vwI-2B-2B>
discovered in the *JetMenu* plugin. We detected the plugin on one or more
of your websites:

• huntleyv2

*You can ignore this message if you have already updated JetMenu to the
latest version or have it set to update automatically.*

The plugin has a vulnerability that makes it possible for authenticated
users with subscriber (and higher) permissions to view sensitive user and
configuration data.

This vulnerability affects versions before 2.4.11.2. We recommend updating
this plugin immediately to the latest version. To update, log in to MyKinsta
<https://u9019290.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.6QPP-2FqJt5LKc0sK5s9FWuqfnKhH4mQmF-2FbsgKxDIHqo-3DnNfR_QhWGwQhi9gh0EXq7EEln2gTtEY8uizMkeyIYnCUJGKBxDCOY-2FXiHEygCmLGWHMZTzD-2FzbwQvzsWcSt9WEyrRxtri5MjxTiZ2d2LJZuV7GN8kQJJswGECh1qWi-2FMN6xTP381svFx8R2Tc2liVfTUuS82fl3fd2mc-2Brw79gd-2BJTcD65zT1BA80Yn7DrCaqmgg-2Be-2FvpAUjr-2F967ZlSUDKcVkdNKaNbEE08j3MgZmATW1HidWLqzKewL58GhuFt4Wlyb>
and go to WordPress sites > *site name* > Plugins and themes > Installed
plugins > JetMenu, and click the "Update" button.

To check all sites in your account for plugin updates, go to "WordPress
sites" and click the "Plugins" tab. That will list all the plugins
installed across all of your sites. A number greater than zero in the
"Updates" column means an update is available. (There's also a "Themes" tab
allowing you to update all themes installed on your sites.)

If you're interested in automatic plugin and theme updates with visual
regression testing, consider the Kinsta Automatic Updates
<https://u9019290.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.6QPP-2FqJt5LKc0sK5s9FWuowMewsD0yG1GbJf9SzgPBq992qho52qQ0fhXJGSTe-2FrdiVke-2B-2B9y36CrlFrkVTTBzJSYBaU2zMagshlsO2heoKpM28H6xMPPfA0lQqwWU-2FmEGA4-2FuZO-2Bo0B1-2BDBn9-2FtSmeOGRcfSZgLRtwhNr9vGOc-3DBT_g_QhWGwQhi9gh0EXq7EEln2gTtEY8uizMkeyIYnCUJGKBxDCOY-2FXiHEygCmLGWHMZTFPuemUldr07pvQhkAaFe8WmsvDbWohQAgH4TNNLCaKKSEAbU-2BWMGRCXu6CjO52KNcJI7NcflXBfkjUnQN9gVOujqmWO-2FPP7iL52kfV82dim7Hfq0oRnLpgZtiYAjhRUIjrZ5mP129kHbEj6LYw8WM-2BtaBpcE5NSfTH650wWqQO2bHeywIlq4NTP1IC8Efyl-2F>
add-on. To activate Kinsta Automatic Updates, go to MyKinsta > WordPress
sites > *site name* > Plugins and themes and click the "Auto-update
settings" button. Then select "Kinsta Automatic Updates."

We detected this vulnerability on July 23rd, 2025, at 1:45 PM UTC, but due
to the time difference between scanning for vulnerabilities and sending
notifications, you may have already updated the plugin.

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact our support team.

Thank you for being a Kinsta client!
